titleproper.value: Guide to the Larry Rivers Papers<lb/>1952-2010<lb/> <num>MSS.293</num>

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2017-11-28T14:54:23</date>

extent.value: (100 record cartons, 51 document cases, 97 photo binders, 11 oversize boxes)

abstract.value: The Larry Rivers Papers include correspondence, manuscripts, source material, financial and administrative records, photographic material, project files, and audiovisual material related to the life of Larry Rivers, and to his work as an artist, poet, filmmaker and musician.

p.value: Some materials have been restricted by Fales Library and the Larry Rivers Foundation due to potentially sensitive information contained in certain areas. Restricted materials are clearly indicated in the finding aid.

Published citations should take the following form:<lb/><lb/>Identification of item,  date (if known); Larry Rivers Papers; MSS 293; box number; folder number; Fales Library and Special Collections, New York University Libraries.
For comprehensive biographical information and chronology, visit the Larry Rivers Foundation at: http://www.larryriversfoundation.org.

The Larry Rivers Papers include correspondence, manuscripts, ephemera, photographic material, business and administrative records, source material, film, video recordings, audio Recordings, sheet music, legal and financial records. Materials in the archive document Rivers’ life and career as a painter, poet, videographer, filmmaker, and musician. The collection is arranged into 17 series:<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref4985.html">Series I: Correspondence</extref> primarily contains personal correspondence. As many of Rivers’ personal friends were also associates and collaborators, the content of this series often straddles the line between the personal and the professional.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref6281.html">Series II: Manuscripts & Writings</extref> contains written works by Rivers as well as manuscripts and drafts of works by other artists, including poems, plays, films, interviews, lectures, papers, and Rivers’ autobiography.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref4796.html">Series III: Photographic Material</extref> contains photographic prints, slides, contact sheets and negatives. In addition to the collection of photographic prints documenting Rivers’ life and career, this series contains several inventory binders and source material.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref6674.html">Series IV: Project Files</extref> contains archival materials related to the artistic career of Larry Rivers. These include business correspondence, exhibition files, preparatory notes, ephemera and work documentation.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref7189.html">Series V: Source Material</extref> contains source files for Rivers’ artworks, primarily photographic material.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref6681.html">Series VI: Clippings</extref> contains articles clipped from newspapers, magazines and other published materials, some to be used as research material, others for documentation purposes.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref7394.html">Series VII: Music</extref> contains materials related to Rivers’ musical career, including sheet music, correspondence and ephemera related to different bands and musical performances.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref8797.html">Series VIII: Administrative Files</extref> contains materials related to the operations of Larry Rivers’ Studio. These include memoranda, meeting minutes, documentation of conservation work and artwork photography, and collections of exhibition documentation for both Larry Rivers and other artists.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref8849.html">Series IX: Financial Records</extref> contains financial records related to Larry Rivers’ personal and artistic career. This series is restricted; permission must be obtained from a Fales archivist for access to these materials.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref8875.html">Series X: Legal Records</extref> contains legal documents, including those related to specific legal cases, law research, and parking/traffic violations.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref8876.html">Series XI: Medical Records</extref> contains medical records. This series is restricted.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref8874.html">Series XII: Real Estate</extref> contains records related to properties owned by Larry Rivers. These include homes in Southampton and Zihuatanejo, Mexico, as well as the famous loft at 404 East 14th Street.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref7409.html">Series XIII: Personal Files</extref> contains materials unrelated to Larry Rivers’ artistic or musical career. These include files related to Rivers’ family and various community/outreach organizations.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref3132.html">Series XIV: Audio</extref> contains audio cassettes and reels.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref3614.html">Series XV: Film</extref> contains film reels, primarily 16mm acetate film.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref3.html">Series XVI: Video</extref> contains ½” open reel, ¾” Umatic, VHS, and Betamax video.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref8803.html">Series XVII: Data Storage</extref> comprises seven 3 ½” floppy disks containing source material.<lb/><lb/><extref href="http://dlib.nyu.edu/findingaids/html/fales/rivers/dscref8877.html">Series XVIII: Commercial Media Collection</extref> comprises Rivers’ collection of vinyl records, audiocassettes, CDs and DVDs.

dsc.value:
Series I: CorrespondenceScope and Content

Series I: Correspondence contains Larry Rivers's personal correspondence. It has been separated into four subseries: personal correspondence from named correspondents, correspondence from unknown senders, fan mail, and non-unique and informal correspondence. Each subseries is described in greater detail below.

Subseries A: Known SendersScope and Content

Subseries A features personal correspondence from known and identified senders -- or recipients, as pertaining to drafts of letters written by Rivers.

Arrangement

Materials are arranged alphabetically by surname. In cases where the correspondent's first name is given but surname is not known, the first name is used as identifier. Within each folder, materials are arranged chronologically. Important clarifying information about specific items may be included below in notes.

Subseries C contains materials regarded loosely as "fan mail." These include but are not limited to autograph requests, casual inquiries about Rivers's work, and responses to public appearances. Materials are arranged chronologically.

ImagesundatedD21Series IV: Project FilesScope and Content

Series IV: Project Files contains documents related directly to the artistic career of Larry Rivers. These have been arranged into three subseries, based upon their original arrangement and notation schemes of Rivers and his studio.

Arrangement

The three subseries were chosen based upon the original notations of Rivers and his studio. Three separate filing strategies emerged during the course of processing the collection; the subseries correspond with these rubricks.

Subseries A: Artwork TrackingScope and Content

Subseries A contains correspondence and records related to sales, loans and exhibitions of Rivers' artworks.

Arrangement

The title "artwork tracking" was chosen based on the term's frequent recurrence on original boxes and folders. Materials are arranged alphabetically by folder title; within each folder, materials are in their original order. Folders with identical titles are arranged by date. Any titles inferred by the archivist are enclosed in square brackets.

Series V: Source Material contains source files for Larry Rivers' work.

Arrangement

This series is split into two subseries. The first comprises the source file, as maintained by Rivers and his studio. The second comprises source files found outside of the numbered source file.

Subseries A: Source FileScope and Content

Subseries A comprises the source file maintained by Larry Rivers and his studio.

Arrangement

Materials are in their original order; each numbered source file comprised a large packet or hanging file folder containing several more specific folders. Subjects contained in each numbered source file are listed in expository notes. Original folder labels have been retained in each folder.

Series XIII: Personal Files contains materials in the archive unrelated to Larry Rivers’ artistic or musical career. These include files related to Rivers’ family and various community/outreach organizations.

Arrangement

Materials are arranged alphabetically by folder title. Items within each folder are in their original order. Any titles inferred by the archivist are enclosed in square brackets.

Series XV: Motion Picture FilmScope and Content

Series XV: Film contains motion picture film reels, primarily 16mm acetate film.

Arrangement

Films were given unique identification numbers in their original order. Unique titles are based upon annotations on original items and their containers. Alternate titles are offered where multiple titles were implied by container annotations, or in the case of uniform titles for series of items.

Conditions Governing Access

Motion picture films have not been preserved and may not be available to researchers.

Series XVI: Video recordingsScope and Content

Series XVI: Video contains ½” open reel, ¾” Umatic, VHS, and Betamax video.

Arrangement

Video items were given unique identification numbers in their original order. Unique titles are based upon annotations on original items and their containers. Alternate titles are offered where multiple titles were implied by container annotations, or in the case of uniform titles for series of items.

Conditions Governing Access

Access copies for some materials are available by appointment for reading room viewing and listening only. Please contact fales.library@nyu.edu, 212-998-2596.

Subseries A: Video RecordingsCalifornia TripID: 293.0001_a1972116ID: 293.0001_aPhysical Characteristics and Technical RequirementsBlack and White/Sound, Duration: 30 minutes Original format: 1/2 in. Open ReelContent Description:

While in California, Rivers taught a course at University of California, Santa Barbara, and gathered material for use in the operatic adaptation of Kenneth Koch's poem, "The Artist". This tape primarily contains home movie-style footage taken around the western United States.

Conditions Governing Access

Currently available.
